description: Specialized rehabilitation exercises for ligament injuries following systematic progression: stability→mobility→strengthening

rehabilitation_phases.phase_1_protection: 0-2 weeks: Protection, reduce inflammation, maintain range of motion
rehabilitation_phases.phase_2_mobility: 2-6 weeks: Restore mobility, begin stability training
rehabilitation_phases.phase_4_return_to_activity: 12+ weeks: Sport-specific training, return to full activity

EX_251.name: LCL Injury - Lateral Knee Stability Training

en.name: LCL Injury - Lateral Knee Stability Training
en.description: Progressive stability training for lateral collateral ligament recovery
instructions: Begin with partial weight bearing as tolerated
Practice single-leg balance with lateral perturbations
Progress to lateral step-downs with control
Add resistance band for varus/valgus control
Include proprioceptive training on unstable surfaces
common_errors: Progressing too quickly to full weight bearing

en.name: PCL Tear - Posterior Glide Prevention
en.description: Quadriceps strengthening to prevent posterior tibial translation
instructions: Avoid hamstring strengthening in early phases
Focus on quadriceps strengthening in closed chain
Perform quad sets with posterior support
Progress to partial squats with anterior weight shift
Include eccentric quadriceps control training

en.name: ATFL Tear - Ankle Inversion Control
en.description: Progressive stability training for anterior talofibular ligament recovery
instructions: Begin with peroneal strengthening exercises
Practice single-leg balance with eyes closed
Progress to balance on unstable surfaces
Include controlled inversion/eversion movements
Add sport-specific cutting movements when appropriate
cues: Keep ankle neutral, don't let it roll in

en.name: CFL Tear - Lateral Ankle Stabilization
en.description: Advanced stabilization for calcaneofibular ligament recovery
instructions: Perform resistance band eversion exercises
Practice multi-planar balance challenges
Include lateral plyometric movements
Add agility ladder drills with lateral emphasis
Progress to sport-specific movement patterns

en.name: UCL Elbow - Valgus Stress Protection
en.description: Protective exercises and strengthening for ulnar collateral ligament
instructions: Avoid overhead throwing motions initially
Strengthen wrist flexors and pronators
Perform isometric elbow flexion exercises
Include grip strengthening activities
Progress to controlled range of motion exercises

en.name: RCL Elbow - Lateral Stability Training
en.description: Lateral elbow stability for radial collateral ligament recovery
instructions: Strengthen wrist extensors and supinators
Perform elbow stabilization exercises
Include grip strengthening with emphasis on lateral pinch
Practice functional reaching and lifting patterns
Progress to dynamic stability challenges

en.name: AC Joint - Superior Translation Control
en.description: Controlled exercises for acromioclavicular joint recovery
instructions: Avoid overhead lifting in early phases
Strengthen scapular stabilizers
Perform pendulum exercises for mobility
Progress to assisted range of motion
Include postural correction exercises
common_errors: Not using arm support during healing

en.name: SC Joint - Anterior-Posterior Stability
en.description: Gentle mobility and protection for sternoclavicular joint
instructions: Perform gentle neck and shoulder blade movements
Avoid forceful arm swinging or lifting
Include breathing exercises to promote mobility
Focus on postural awareness and correction
Progress to gentle strengthening when pain-free

en.name: Coracoclavicular Ligament - Vertical Stability
en.description: Progressive strengthening for coracoclavicular ligament complex
instructions: Strengthen scapular upward rotators
Perform controlled clavicular depression exercises
Include resistance training for shoulder girdle
Practice functional lifting patterns
Progress to overhead activities gradually
cues: Pull shoulder blades down and together
Control upward movement of collar bone

en.name: Iliolumbar Ligament - Lumbosacral Stability
en.description: Deep spinal stabilization for iliolumbar ligament support
instructions: Focus on deep spinal stabilizer strengthening
Perform controlled lumbar mobility exercises
Include hip flexor and IT band stretching
Practice neutral spine maintenance
Progress to functional movement patterns

en.name: MCL Progressive Loading Protocol
en.description: Systematic loading progression for medial collateral ligament
instructions: Begin with isometric quadriceps and hip adductor strengthening
Progress to controlled valgus stress exercises
Include lateral movement patterns with progression
Add plyometric training in later phases
Integrate sport-specific movement patterns
common_errors: Applying excessive valgus stress too early

en.name: Ligament Scar Tissue Management
en.description: Techniques to optimize ligament healing and prevent adhesions
instructions: Apply gentle cross-friction massage to healing ligament
Perform controlled stress to promote proper collagen alignment
Include heat therapy before mobility exercises
Use gentle stretching within pain-free range
Progress tissue loading gradually over time
common_errors: Aggressive treatment too early in healing

en.name: Proprioceptive Ligament Training
en.description: Restore joint position sense and mechanoreceptor function
instructions: Perform balance training on various surfaces
Include joint position sense training
Practice closed-chain stabilization exercises
Add perturbation training for reactive stability
Progress to sport-specific proprioceptive challenges
common_errors: Only training in one plane of movement

en.name: Functional Ligament Integration
en.description: Integrate ligament stability into functional movement patterns
instructions: Practice activity-specific movement patterns
Include multi-planar and multi-joint exercises
Add reactive and unpredictable elements
Progress speed and complexity gradually
Test ligament function under sport demands
common_errors: Inadequate testing before return to activity

en.name: ACL Prevention Protocol
en.description: Evidence-based protocol for ACL injury prevention
instructions: Include neuromuscular training components
Perform proper landing and cutting mechanics
Strengthen posterior chain muscles
Practice balance and proprioceptive training
Include plyometric progression with proper form
cues: Land softly with knees over toes
Keep knees behind toes during squatting

en.name: Ligament Healing Nutrition Support
en.description: Nutritional strategies to optimize ligament healing
instructions: Ensure adequate protein intake for collagen synthesis
Include vitamin C for collagen cross-linking
Add anti-inflammatory foods to diet
Maintain proper hydration for tissue health
Consider supplements like glucosamine and omega-3s

en.name: Sleep and Recovery for Ligaments
en.description: Optimize sleep and recovery for ligament healing
instructions: Maintain 7-9 hours of quality sleep nightly
Create consistent sleep schedule
Use proper positioning to support injured area
Include stress management techniques
Monitor recovery markers and adjust training
common_errors: Poor positioning causing stress on healing tissue
Not managing stress that impairs healing

en.name: Return to Sport Testing - Ligaments
en.description: Comprehensive testing before return to sport after ligament injury
instructions: Test strength symmetry between limbs
Assess functional movement patterns
Evaluate sport-specific skills under fatigue
Check psychological readiness and confidence
Ensure meeting all return-to-play criteria

en.name: Chronic Ligament Instability Management
en.description: Long-term management strategies for chronic ligament instability
instructions: Develop compensatory muscle strength
Use external support (bracing/taping) as needed
Modify activities to reduce instability episodes
Maintain proprioceptive training long-term
Consider surgical consultation if conservative management fails
common_errors: Not accepting need for long-term modifications

en.name: Multi-Ligament Injury Protocol
en.description: Complex rehabilitation for multiple ligament injuries
instructions: Address each ligament according to specific healing timelines
Coordinate rehabilitation phases for different structures
Include comprehensive strength and stability training
Plan extended rehabilitation timeline
Consider multi-disciplinary approach with surgical team
common_errors: Missing psychological impact of complex injury

en.name: Pediatric Ligament Injury Adaptations
en.description: Age-appropriate modifications for pediatric ligament injuries
instructions: Consider growth plate status and protection
Use age-appropriate exercise progressions
Include family education and involvement
Address psychological impact on young athlete
Coordinate with pediatric specialists as needed

en.name: Geriatric Ligament Injury Considerations
en.description: Age-specific modifications for older adult ligament injuries
instructions: Account for slower healing rates in older adults
Include balance and fall prevention components
Address comorbidities affecting healing
Use assistive devices as appropriate
Focus on functional goals and quality of life

en.name: Gender-Specific Ligament Considerations
en.description: Account for gender differences in ligament injury and healing
instructions: Address higher ACL injury rates in female athletes
Consider hormonal influences on ligament healing
Include gender-specific movement pattern training
Address anatomical differences affecting injury risk
Provide gender-appropriate education and support

en.name: Post-Surgical Ligament Reconstruction
en.description: Specialized protocol for post-surgical ligament reconstruction
instructions: Follow surgeon-specific protocol and restrictions
Protect graft during healing phases
Progress according to tissue healing timeline
Include comprehensive rehabilitation program
Plan for extended recovery and return to activity

en.name: Ligament Injury Prevention Education
en.description: Comprehensive education program for ligament injury prevention
instructions: Teach anatomy and function of ligaments
Explain injury mechanisms and risk factors
Demonstrate proper movement techniques

Provide resources for ongoing education

en.name: Technology-Assisted Ligament Rehabilitation
en.description: Integration of technology for enhanced ligament rehabilitation
instructions: Use biofeedback for movement quality training
Include virtual reality for functional training

Integrate apps for home exercise compliance

Not teaching patients to exercise without devices

en.name: Mental Health and Ligament Recovery
en.description: Address psychological aspects of ligament injury and recovery
instructions: Acknowledge emotional impact of injury

cues: Fear is normal, work through it
Focus on what you can control

en.description: Rehabilitation focused on return to work demands

en.description: Plan ligament health throughout athletic seasons
